intro: Peucedanum capense, commonly known as African cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Peucedanum capense is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
